acceptedAnswer.text: Scam ads are fraudulent advertisements on social media platforms that use fake celebrity endorsements, deepfake videos, and phishing schemes to deceive users. They commonly appear on Meta (Facebook/Instagram), YouTube, TikTok, and other major platforms, causing over $119 billion in annual losses globally.

mainEntity.name: How much do scam ads cost victims?

acceptedAnswer.text: Global scam ad losses exceed $119 billion annually. In 2024, Europe lost $108 billion, the United States $16.6 billion, Taiwan $1.61 billion, Hong Kong $1.17 billion, Singapore $814.8 million, Canada $466 million, and Malaysia $345 million. These numbers continue to rise in 2025.

Scam ads work in three steps: 1) Scammers create fake ads using stolen identities, deepfakes, and automation. 2) Platforms distribute these ads to millions and profit from every view. 3) Users trust the platform, lose money, data, and privacy. For just $8 in ad spend, scammers can reach 1,000 users on YouTube.

mainEntity.name: What is StopScamAds doing about this?

acceptedAnswer.text: StopScamAds is a global campaign collecting evidence of scam ads, raising public awareness, conducting polls to measure user exposure, engaging with creators and communities, and demanding platform accountability. We publish real scam ad examples and push for AI-powered ad screening, mandatory transparency reports, and user reward mechanisms.

mainEntity.name: How can I report scam ads?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can submit scam ads through our website at https://3ja.com by providing a screen recording of the scam ad, platform type, and your contact information. All submissions are used for research and public reporting to expose fraud networks and protect users.

mainEntity.name: Why do platforms allow scam ads?

acceptedAnswer.text: Platforms profit from scam ads through high CPC/CPM rates. Strict review would reduce ad revenue, and review costs are high requiring OCR, frame analysis, and deepfake detection. Scam ads are not treated as systemic risks but as acceptable costs of doing business, despite causing massive financial harm to users.

@graph.name: How to Report Scam Ads
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to reporting scam ads to StopScamAds

step.name: Record the Scam Ad
step.text: Use screen recording to capture the scam ad on your device

step.name: Upload Recording
step.text: Upload your screen recording to Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive, iCloud Drive, or WeTransfer and set sharing to 'Anyone with the link can view'

step.name: Submit Form
step.text: Fill out the submission form at 3ja.com with your contact information, platform type, and recording link

step.name: Complete Verification
step.text: Complete the Cloudflare Turnstile verification to prevent spam

step.name: Submit Report
step.text: Submit your report. All submissions are used for research and public reporting (anonymized)
